Class Bus

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Bus
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class representing a bus
    Version:
    0.3, 05/12/2016
    Author:
    Krystof Spiller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bus

        public Bus(java.lang.String uniqueNumber,
           java.lang.String plateNumber,
           java.lang.String manufacturer,
           java.lang.String model,
           int manufacturingYear,
           int[] seatNumbers)
        Six-argument constructor. Color is set to black. Toilet and party bus variables are set to false. Schedules variable is initialized as an arraylist.
        Parameters:
        uniqueNumber - the company's unique ID for each bus as a String
        plateNumber - the plate number as a String
        manufacturer - the manufacturer of a bus as a String
        model - the model of a bus as a String
        manufacturingYear - the manufacturing year as an integer, has to be between 1900 and current year
        seatNumbers - the seat numbers as an array of integers

        public Schedule[] getSchedules()
        Converts an arraylist to an array and returns it.
        Returns:
        the schedules as an array of Schedule objects

      • getWeekSchedule

        public boolean[][] getWeekSchedule()
        Compares following 168 hours with all the schedules for the bus. If an hour is overlaping with bus schedule, the respective hour is set to true in a two dimensional array. First dimension represents the number of days, second number of hours in a day.
        Returns:
        the week schedule as a two dimensional array of booleans

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(DateTime from,
                           DateTime to)
        Checks if the bus is available in a given date interval
        Parameters:
        from - Starting date as an object of type DateTime
        to - Ending date as an object of type DateTime
        Returns:
        true if the bus is available

        Returns:

        public boolean hasToilet()
        Returns:
        if the bus has a toilet as a boolean

      • setPlateNumber

        public void setPlateNumber(java.lang.String plateNumber)
        Sets the plate number if the inputed plate number is seven characters long. Otherwise exception for illegal argument is thrown.
        Parameters:
        plateNumber - the plate number of a bus as a String

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.lang.String color)

      • setParty

        public void setParty(boolean party)
        Sets if a bus is a party bus or not.
        Parameters:
        party - boolean representing if a bus is a party bus (true) or not (false)

      • setToilet

        public void setToilet(boolean toilet)
        Sets if a bus has a toilet or not.
        Parameters:
        toilet - boolean representing if a bus has a toilet (true) or not (false)

      • addSchedule

        public void addSchedule(Schedule schedule)
        Add a schedule to bus schedules only if the inputed schedule doesn't overlap with other schedules. Otherwise it has no effect.
        Parameters:
        schedule - an object of type Schedule

      • removeSchedule

        public void removeSchedule(Schedule schedule)
        Removes a schedules from bus schedules.
        Parameters:
        schedule - an object of type Schedule
